challenge.title: Use Destructuring Assignment to Pass an Object as a Function's Parameters
challenge.description:
In some cases, you can destructure the object in a function argument itself.

Consider the code below:

const profileUpdate = (profileData) => {
  const { name, age, nationality, location } = profileData;

}

This effectively destructures the object sent into the function. This can also be done in-place:

const profileUpdate = ({ name, age, nationality, location }) => {

}

When profileData is passed to the above function, the values are destructured from the function parameter for use within the function.
challenge.instructions: Use destructuring assignment within the argument to the function half to send only max and min inside the function.
